content:
A video appearing to depict North Korean leader Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game went viral on social media, causing speculation as to the video's authenticity. "It almost looks like it was generated by AI," one Reddit user wrote about the video.
On Jan. 23, 2024, X (formerly Twitter) account @historyinmemes shared the video, captioned "Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game." In less than 24 hours, the post gained more than 33,900,000 views and 132,000 likes.
Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game pic.twitter.com/BN1KNMbko0
— Historic Vids (@historyinmemes) January 24, 2024

A Google reverse-image search of a screenshot from the video produced a news story dated Aug. 29, 2023 (archived) from South Korean news outlet Yonhap News Agency. It included a photo of Kim Jong Un and his young daughter, estimated to be 10 years old, watching the volleyball match. It was captioned as follows:
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un (C), alongside his daughter Ju-ae (2nd from L), acknowledges the crowd as he watches a volleyball game between teams of the navy and air force on Aug. 27, 2023, on the occasion of Navy Day that fell the next day in this photo captured from the North's official Korean Central Television on Aug. 29.
The original broadcast footage can be found on the website of the Korean Central News Agency (KCNA), the official state news agency of North Korea (beginning at 29:23).
The extensive footage of the North Korean leader and his daughter was televised in honor of Navy Day, as reported by other outlets, including NBC News.

The Associated Press also published a story about the outing that concluded by highlighting the speculation surrounding his daughter's political future.
State media photos showed Kim visiting the navy headquarters with his daughter, reportedly named Ju Ae and aged about 10. It was her first public appearance since mid-May. Kim has brought her to a series of public events since November, sparking speculation about her political status.
South Korean officials say Kim hasn’t anointed her as his heir. They believe Kim likely attempts to use his daughter’s public appearance as a way to show his people that one of his children would one day inherit his power in what would be the country’s third hereditary power transfer.
In sum, the video of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and his daughter watching a volleyball game is indeed authentic. It was aired on North Korean television on Aug. 29, 2023.

original_rationales.main_rational: In sum, the video of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and his daughter watching a volleyball game is indeed authentic. It was aired on North Korean television on Aug. 29, 2023.
original_rationales.additional_rational1: The original broadcast footage can be found on the website of the Korean Central News Agency (KCNA), the official state news agency of North Korea (beginning at 29:23).
original_rationales.additional_rational2: State media photos showed Kim visiting the navy headquarters with his daughter, reportedly named Ju Ae and aged about 10.

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim that the viral video of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game is authentic is rated as 'True' based on evidence from South Korean news outlet Yonhap News Agency and the Associated Press, along with confirmation of the video's contents on North Korean state media. The video was widely shared on social media platforms and matched publicized events involving Kim Jong Un and his daughter, providing strong verification of its authenticity.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The video in question, depicting Kim Jong Un at a volleyball game, was shared on social media platforms, quickly gaining widespread attention and sparking discussions about its credibility.
detailed_reasons.reason2: A reverse-image search of a screenshot from the video led to a news story by South Korean news outlet Yonhap News Agency dated August 29, 2023, which matched the contents of the video and provided further verification of its authenticity.
detailed_reasons.reason3: Additional corroboration for the authenticity of the video came from the Associated Press, which reported on Kim Jong Un's public appearances with his daughter around the same time as the volleyball game, aligning with the events shown in the video and emphasizing its validity.
detailed_reasons.reason4: The mention of the video footage being originally broadcast by the Korean Central News Agency, North Korea's state news agency, further solidifies the video's authenticity by confirming its presence in official media coverage.

evidence1:
Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game pic.twitter.com/BN1KNMbko0
— Historic Vids (@historyinmemes) January 24, 2024
evidence2: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un (C), alongside his daughter Ju-ae (2nd from L), acknowledges the crowd as he watches a volleyball game between teams of the navy and air force on Aug. 27, 2023, on the occasion of Navy Day that fell the next day in this photo captured from the North's official Korean Central Television on Aug. 29.
evidence3:
State media photos showed Kim visiting the navy headquarters with his daughter, reportedly named Ju Ae and aged about 10. It was her first public appearance since mid-May. Kim has brought her to a series of public events since November, sparking speculation about her political status.
South Korean officials say Kim hasn’t anointed her as his heir. They believe Kim likely attempts to use his daughter’s public appearance as a way to show his people that one of his children would one day inherit his power in what would be the country’s third hereditary power transfer.

relationship_with_evidence.<main_rational,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game aligns perfectly with the rationale detail that the video of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and his daughter watching a volleyball game is authentic. The fact that the evidence specifically shows Kim Jong Un engaged in the activity mentioned in the rationale supports the claim's authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rational1,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game aligns directly with the rationale that the original broadcast footage can be found on the website of the Korean Central News Agency (KCNA), confirming the authenticity of the video.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason1,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail, confirming the authenticity of the viral video showing Kim Jong Un at a volleyball game.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the rationale by confirming the authenticity of the viral video through a match with the news story found via the reverse-image search.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason3,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game directly aligns with the Associated Press report on his public appearances with his daughter during the same period, providing concrete support for the authenticity of the video.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason4,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game directly aligns with the rationale as it confirms the existence of the video by showing Kim Jong Un at the event. This supports the claim that the video is authentic, as its presence in official media coverage is substantiated.

relationship_with_evidence.<main_rational,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the claim's rationale detail by confirming that the video of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game was indeed aired on North Korean television on Aug. 29, 2023, as stated in the rationale.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rational1,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail by confirming the presence of Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game, supporting the claim's authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rational2,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the claim's rationale by confirming that Kim Jong Un was indeed seen with his daughter Ju Ae, around the same time and circumstances as described in the claim, thereby validating the authenticity of the viral video.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason1,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail by describing Kim Jong Un watching a volleyball game, which supports the claim's authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the rationale by confirming that the screenshot from the video matches a news story by Yonhap News Agency, providing further verification of the video's authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason3,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail by confirming Kim Jong Un's presence at a volleyball game with his daughter around the same time, validating the authenticity of the video in question.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason4,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the rationale by confirming that the video footage was indeed broadcast by the Korean Central Television, North Korea's official news agency, aligning with the claim of the video's authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.<main_rational,evidence3>: Supportive. The evidence supports the claim by providing details about Kim Jong Un and his daughter's public appearances, which align with the rationale's description of them watching a volleyball game together on North Korean television.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rational2,evidence3>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail by confirming that state media photos showed Kim visiting the navy headquarters with his daughter, reportedly named Ju Ae and aged about 10, thus supporting the authenticity of the claim regarding the viral video.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason1,evidence3>: Supportive. The evidence provided directly supports the rationale that the video in question, depicting Kim Jong Un at a volleyball game, is authentic. The evidence shows that Kim Jong Un has been bringing his daughter to public events since November, sparking speculation about her political status. This supports the credibility of the video by indicating that Kim Jong Un is indeed making public appearances with his daughter, aligning with the rationale's discussion about the video's widespread attention and credibility.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence3>: For responses classified as 'Irrelevant', only the word 'Irrelevant' should be used, with no further explanation. For 'Supportive' or 'Refute', first state the classification followed by a detailed explanation.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason3,evidence3>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the rationale by providing details of Kim Jong Un's public appearances with his daughter around the same time as the volleyball game, thereby corroborating the authenticity of the video.
